page.title: 17Mousehole Harbour Lights
page.content: At{Christmas}1984,{Simon Groom}of the{BBC Blue Peter}programme, came to {Mousehole}to perform the ceremony of switching on the harbour lights on its twenty-first anniversary.{ It all started when a number of local men decided to brighten up {Christmas}by putting up a string of lights around the harbour front. The money to purchase the lights was collected from the local people and over the years the number of displays has increased and they have become larger. If you visit Mousehole at Christmas time, entering the village from the{Penzance}or eastern end of the village, you will see six large set-pieces lit up around the hills at the back of the village. In the village itself there are strings of lights along both the quays and all around the houses.
